comments.raw_text:
Hello,

Firefox 6.0. Mac OS X 10.6.8.
See screen film :
http://screencast.com/t/NLKmS5pyNN
I right-click in the page background. I get the Firefox contextual menu. I right-click elsewhere in the page background. I get again the Firefox contextual menu. This is correct. I click outside the contextual menu. It goes away.
I right-click in the page background. I get the Firefox contextual menu. I right-click in the Flash video. I get the Flash contextual menu. This is correct. I click outside the contextual menu. It goes away.
I right-click in the Flash video. I get the Flash contextual menu. I right-click in the page background.

Expected behaviour :

I get the Firefox contextual menu. This is correct.

Actual behaviour :

The Firefox contextual menu flicks away. This is incorrect.

Please fix that.

Thanks.

Nicolas
comments.creator: nicolas.barbulesco@supinfo.com

comments.raw_text:
Reproducible for me on Mozilla/5.0 (Macintosh; Intel Mac OS X 10.6; rv:9.0a1) Gecko/20110912 Firefox/9.0a1

Simplified STR:
1. Go to youtube for example and play a video.
2. Right-click on the video and the flash context menu appears.With the context menu in focus
3. With the context menu in focus, right-click again but in the background.

Actual results:
The firefox context menu does not appear, just a flicker.

Setting resolution to NEW.

Expected results:
The menu should appear.
